verses.text: And it shall be, when thou art come in unto the land which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God giveth thee \add for\add* an inheritance, and possessest it, and dwellest therein;

that thou shalt take of the first of all the fruit of the earth, which thou shalt bring of thy land that the \sc Lord\sc* thy God giveth thee, and shalt put \add it\add* in a basket, and shalt go unto the place which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God shall choose to place his name there.

And thou shalt go unto the priest that shall be in those days, and say unto him, I profess \add this\add* day unto the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, that I am come unto the country which the \sc Lord\sc* sware unto our fathers for to give us.
And the priest shall take the basket out of thine hand, and set it down before the altar of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God.

And thou shalt speak and say before the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, A Syrian ready to perish \add was\add* my father, and he went down into Egypt, and sojourned there with a few, and became there a nation, great, mighty, and populous:
and the Egyptians evil entreated us, and afflicted us, and laid upon us hard bondage:
and when we cried unto the \sc Lord\sc* God of our fathers, the \sc Lord\sc* heard our voice, and looked on our affliction, and our labour, and our oppression:
and the \sc Lord\sc* brought us forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with great terribleness, and with signs, and with wonders:
and he hath brought us into this place, and hath given us this land, \add even\add* a land that floweth with milk and honey.

And now, behold, I have brought the firstfruits of the land, which thou, O \sc Lord\sc*, hast given me. And thou shalt set it before the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, and worship before the \sc Lord\sc* thy God:
and thou shalt rejoice in every good \add thing\add* which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath given unto thee, and unto thine house, thou, and the Levite, and the stranger that \add is\add* among you.

When thou hast made an end of tithing all the tithes of thine increase the third year, \add which is\add* the year of tithing, and hast given \add it\add* unto the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, that they may eat within thy gates, and be filled;

then thou shalt say before the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, I have brought away the hallowed \add things\add* out of \add mine\add* house, and also have given them unto the Levite, and unto the stranger, to the fatherless, and to the widow, according to all thy commandments which thou hast commanded me: I have not transgressed thy commandments, neither have I forgotten \add them:\add*

I have not eaten thereof in my mourning, neither have I taken away \add ought\add* thereof for \add any\add* unclean \add use\add*, nor given \add ought\add* thereof for the dead: \add but\add* I have hearkened to the voice of the \sc Lord\sc* my God, \add and\add* have done according to all that thou hast commanded me.
Look down from thy holy habitation, from heaven, and bless thy people Israel, and the land which thou hast given us, as thou swarest unto our fathers, a land that floweth with milk and honey.
This day the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath commanded thee to do these statutes and judgments: thou shalt therefore keep and do them with all thine heart, and with all thy soul.
Thou hast avouched the \sc Lord\sc* \add this\add* day to be thy God, and to walk in his ways, and to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his judgments, and to hearken unto his voice:
and the \sc Lord\sc* hath avouched thee \add this\add* day to be his peculiar people, as he hath promised thee, and that \add thou\add* shouldest keep all his commandments;
and to make thee high above all nations which he hath made, in praise, and in name, and in honour; and that thou mayest be a holy people unto the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, as he hath spoken.
